Description: Large marl pottery bowl with flat base and flaring sides; interior coated with red slip and loosely burnished. Exterior smoothed at rim with some slip applied. Exterior body scraped to shape.
Curator's comments: Polished red ware P22a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Grave discussed in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), p. 34
